candidates.name: Rachel Keedwell
candidates.why_elect: In my two terms on Horizons, I have been a committed and passionate advocate for people and the environment. I've positively influenced council debates and actions and I have consistently pushed for sustainability in all council decision-making.
candidates.why_stand: The regional council is well represented by business and farming interests but does not have a strong environmental voice, despite its crucial role of environmental stewardship. I will use my skills as an ecologist to advocate for sound environmental management to ensure there is a future for all our children.

candidates.name: Jono Naylor
candidates.why_elect: I believe that my 17 years experience in local and central government alongside my community involvement ensures that I well equipped to continue to serve our community in this role.
candidates.why_stand: I am committed to this region and have devoted a good part of my life to improving it where I can. I want to ensure that we are doing the best for our environment and our people now and into the future.

candidates.name: Chris Teo-Sherrell
candidates.why_elect: Hard-working, knowledgeable and of highest integrity—that's how others describe me. I also have 9 years experience on city council, 6 years at central government, a PhD, plus decades of commitment to environmental protection and seeking fairness. I stand up for what I believe and I walk my talk.
candidates.why_stand: We are at a crossroads. Decisions need to be made now to enable this region to thrive environmentally, socially and economically in the face of climate change and other challenges. With my experience, contacts and knowledge I can help us make the decisions that will make the necessary changes easier.

candidates.name: Darryl Cleland
candidates.why_stand: I'm a born and bred manawatu lad, attended Pnth boys high. Keen outdoor sportsman. Trish and myself have brought up our three children here. Love the place, now want to give something back. To make sure manawatu will still be great for my future generations.

candidates.name: Jack Dowds
candidates.why_elect: I have lived here for a long time and my experience in governance, local government management as CEO of a District Council and general management equip me to be an effective representative. I understand both the technical and financial areas of local government.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about this region and I believe that I can contribute to its well-being and development.

candidates.name: Fiona Gordon
candidates.why_elect: As a local business woman, mum of two, Trustee to the Palmerston North City Environmental Trust and an Ambassador to the Jane Goodall Institute NZ, I understand what matters in our community. I'm backed by my tertiary qualifications and 24+ years' experience in resource management, including within local government.
candidates.why_stand: I live here because I love it—the lifestyle, landscape and environment. But our environment is not being adequately safeguarded. I'm stepping up, to offer my background and skills in resource management to help make better, long term decisions for a healthy environment and resilient communities.
